text.p: Following are the main stories in Tuesday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Seven factory workers were killed in when a car ploughed into the bus stop they were waiting at.
-- Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad dedicated the two international awards conferred on him recently to all Malaysians.
-- Independent power producers and state-run power utility Tenaga Nasioanal agreed to set up a fund to finance rural electrification projects.
-- The results of the last set of national secodnary school results were the best in twenty years, said Education Minister Najib Tun Razak.
